item.title: The Real BackGround Tut For Clients
item.dc:creator: @Lil_Brudder Lil Brudder (-_-)
item.description:
@Lil_Brudder wrote:

Yeh thats lame cause its no good for webclients. You need to get image from internet not the folder.

Put this at the top

import java.net.URL;

Then switch the image thingy with this

Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage(new URL("http://URL TO YOUR IMAGE"));

Much better

Read full topic

item.title: The Real BackGround Tut For Clients
item.dc:creator: @squal707 squal707
item.description:
@squal707 wrote:

This Tutorial Will Teach You How To Add A Background Image Without Flipping It.

find this in client.java [note it is the second 1 not first]

aClass15_1110.method237(0);

change the entire code to this

        //aClass15_1110.method237(0);
        //class30_sub2_sub1_sub1.method346(382, 0, -32357);
        //aClass15_1111.method237(0);
        //class30_sub2_sub1_sub1.method346(-255, 0, -32357);
        //aClass15_1107.method237(0);
        //class30_sub2_sub1_sub1.method346(254, 0, -32357);
        //aClass15_1108.method237(0);
        //class30_sub2_sub1_sub1.method346(180, -371, -32357);
        //aClass15_1109.method237(0);
        //class30_sub2_sub1_sub1.method346(180, -171, -32357);
        //aClass15_1112.method237(0);
        //class30_sub2_sub1_sub1.method346(382, -265, -32357);
        //aClass15_1113.method237(0);
        //class30_sub2_sub1_sub1.method346(-180, -265, -32357);
        //aClass15_1114.method237(0);
        //class30_sub2_sub1_sub1.method346(254, -171, -32357);
        //aClass15_1115.method237(0);
        if(i != 0)
        {

then
you should see this a couple lines down

Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage(System.getProperty("user.dir") + ("\\BIN\\DATA\\logo.gif"));

the line above it quote it out so it looks like this

//class30_sub2_sub1_sub1.method346(-180, -171, -32357);

Ok Once you did the top party just get an image =p heres an image you can use im supplying you with 2 runescape backgrounds =p [Note i did take my time to make these ready to use, i took the screenie and i cropped them and i filled in the text/loading bar]

Open up Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.java then look for Image image = Toolkit. should see somthing like this

Image image = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage(("./puresscape.jpg"));// put your image name here

The Summing Background

2hob4uo.jpg768×507

The Normal Rs Background

15h21de.png766×502

Credits
70% JaGex
30% Squal707

Read full topic
